dialogues.text: Gondorff, Hooker, Eirie, Billie, Singleton, The Big Ohio the Tuxedo Kid are walking down the island to their train

dialogues.speaker: HOOKER
dialogues.text: Hey, wait a minute, I just thought of somethin'. If Macalinski took the money back from Tuxedo, we didn't make a dime on this thing.

dialogues.speaker: GONDORFF
dialogues.text: Well we didn't exactly come away empty handed. The guy Veronica got Lonnegan to bet his money with was one of our guys too, Freddie Lake outa Jersey City. Hooker just shakes his head. He shoulda known it.

dialogues.speaker: HOOKER
dialogues.text: Then where's my split?

dialogues.speaker: GONDORFF
dialogues.text: Veronica's got it.

dialogues.speaker: HOOKER
dialogues.text: What for?

dialogues.speaker: GONDORFF
dialogues.text: I don't know. Why don't you ask her? She's in car ten, cabin six.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hooker starts for car ten and then turns back to Gondorff

dialogues.speaker: HOOKER
dialogues.text: Henry? What made you think I could beat Kelley?

dialogues.speaker: GONDORFF
dialogues.text: I don't know, Hooker, you got a way of ignoring the reality of things that always pulls you through. Some- day, you're gonna realize what you been doin' all these years and die of fright. I was wrong about one thing, though. I used to think you led a charmed life. Now I can see that you're just the gamest grifter I ever knew. Hooker smiles. He'll take that.

dialogues.speaker: WITH HOOKER 234
dialogues.text: We follow him to car ten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hooker finds Veronica's compartment. The door is open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hooker's cheeks are slightly swollen and there's a bandag over his eye. He looks as bad as Veronica.

dialogues.speaker: HOOKER
dialogues.text: Gondorff tells me you got my split.

dialogues.speaker: VERONICA
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: HOOKER
dialogues.text: Then why aren't ya givin' it to me?

dialogues.speaker: VERONICA
dialogues.text: He told me you'd just blow it. I figured you could use it for better ngs. Like showin' me a good time.

dialogues.speaker: HOOKER
dialogues.text: (incensed) After all you done for me? You start out by takin' my money and then you make a sap outa me for the benefit of a guy who's been tryin’ to kill me for two years. 1% mean you coulda played your role for Lonnegan with- out all the lovey-dovey stuff, the

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 128 236 HOOKER (Cont'd) proper medical attention and all that. Jesus, you finally get me to the point where I can stand ya, and then I find out the whole thing has been a fake. Now you want me to take you places. I wouldn't be mich of a guy if I went for that.

dialogues.speaker: VERONICA
dialogues.text: I didn't say you'd be much. I said you'd be enough for me. Besides, the whole thing wasn't a fake.

dialogues.speaker: HOOKER
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, which parts?

dialogues.speaker: VERONICA
dialogues.text: What do ya think, ya jerk? I don't even know what I got to offer, but you got the best of it. Hooker looks at her a second, wondering if she really mea

dialogues.speaker: HOOKER
dialogues.text: _ I can't believe a thing you say any more, Sheridan. You haven't been straight with me one time since I met you. Veronica pulls out Hooker's money and throws it at him.

dialogues.speaker: VERONICA
dialogues.text: All right, here's your goddamn money. You don't deserve me anyway.

dialogues.speaker: HOOKER
dialogues.text: (picking it up and heading for the door) Sorry, lady, I don't mind you doin’ your job, but I don't like bein' played for a fool.

dialogues.speaker: VERONICA
dialogues.text: So long, Hooker. Thanks for the dance. Hooker nods and walks on out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Hooker gets to the end of the car, he comes face to fa with Gondorff counting a large amount of money into Kelle hands.

dialogues.speaker: KELLEY
dialogues.text: Hey, kid -- you had me worried you wouldn't make it through the first two rounds! (to Gondorff) Thanks, Mr. Gondorff. Kelley jumps off the train, stuffing the money into his p Hooker looks at Gondorff, who shrugs and grins sheepishly Hooker shakes his head helplessly and begins to laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hooker steps off the train as it starts to pull out, The go slowly past him as he heads back toward the terminal, hands deep down in his pockets, his mood turning serious. Just as the last car is about to go past him, he grabs th railing and swings himself back up on the train, a burgeo smile on his face. Helen Forrest's "Takin' A Chance On Lo comes up on the soundtrack and we hold on the train as it recedes into the distance. ‘I thought the cards were a frame up, I never would try. But now I'm taking the game up. And the ace of hearts is high. Things are mending now. I see a rainbow blending now. we'll have our happy ending now. Takin' A Chance On Love.'
